page.title: 15Victoria Park
page.content: Situated near the Guildhall, this {beautiful park}has attractions for all ages. Its many trees include Chestnut, Lime, Sycamore, Poplar, Ash, Willow and Beech. There are beds of roses, tulips, forget-me-nots and pansies. Two hot and steamy greenhouses contain tropical plants. There are{9 cages}of tame{animals including peacocks, budgerigars, tortoises, rabbits and guinea pigs. Notices warn parents not to let children put their fingers through the wires. One peacock will spread its feathers when watched and if you are lucky you can pick up one of the feathers that has fallen out. Around the park are{war memorials and a fountain which was dedicated at the opening in{1878. -S.Russell, E.Longley: Portsmouth High School
